text:
Incentive has been increased for inter-caste marriage from Rs 50,000 to Rs 1,01,000, the Haryana government said on Sunday.

Now, a grant of Rs 1,01,000 would be given to a Scheduled Caste boy or a girl of Haryana who marries a non-Scheduled Caste girl or boy under ‘Mukhyamantri Samajik Samrasta Antarjatiya Vivah Shagun Yojana’, Welfare of Scheduled Castes and Backward Classes Minister Krishan Kumar said.

Apart from this, the grant for girls belonging to SC, denotified tribes and widows living below poverty line has been increased from Rs 31,000 to Rs 41,000, he said.

Mr Kumar said Rs 11,000 will be paid to families with land holdings of less than 2.5 acre or income less than Rs 1 lakh per annum. — PTI
title: Incentive for inter-caste marriage hiked
